options.name: extraEnvironment
options.desc: Extra Environment variables to pass to the conduit server.

options.name: settings
options.desc: Generates the conduit.toml configuration file. Refer to https://docs.conduit.rs/configuration.html for details on supported values. Note that database_path can not be edited because the service’s reliance on systemd StateDir.

options.name: settings.global.address
options.desc: Address to listen on for connections by the reverse proxy/tls terminator.

options.name: settings.global.allow_check_for_updates
options.desc: Whether to allow Conduit to automatically contact https://conduit.rs hourly to check for important Conduit news. Disabled by default because nixpkgs handles updates.

options.name: settings.global.allow_encryption
options.desc: Whether new encrypted rooms can be created. Note: existing rooms will continue to work.

options.name: settings.global.allow_federation
options.desc: Whether this server federates with other servers.

options.name: settings.global.allow_registration
options.desc: Whether new users can register on this server.

options.name: settings.global.database_backend
options.desc: The database backend for the service. Switching it on an existing instance will require manual migration of data.

options.name: settings.global.max_request_size
options.desc: Max request size in bytes. Don’t forget to also change it in the proxy.

options.name: settings.global.port
options.desc: The port Conduit will be running on. You need to set up a reverse proxy in your web server (e.g. apache or nginx), so all requests to /_matrix on port 443 and 8448 will be forwarded to the Conduit instance running on this port
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.name: settings.global.server_name
options.desc: The server_name is the name of this server. It is used as a suffix for user # and room ids.

options.name: settings.global.trusted_servers
options.desc: Servers trusted with signing server keys.
